sentences.sContent: After a shaky start, he rallied and won the title in style.
sentences.sCn: 虽然开局不顺，但他振作精神，最后漂亮地赢得了冠军。

sentences.sContent: The Tokyo stock market rallied later in the day.
sentences.sCn: 当天晚些时候东京股市止跌回升。

synos.tran: 团结；重整；恢复；（网球等）连续对打
团结；集合；恢复健康、力量等

phrases.pCn: 赛前动员会，鼓舞士气的集会

trans.tranCn: 团结；重整；恢复；（网球等）连续对打
trans.tranOther: to become stronger again after a period of weakness or defeat
a large public meeting, especially one that is held outdoors to support a political idea, protest etc
